item.title: Goalkeeper scores spectacular bicycle kick equaliser in South African Premier Division - The Telegraph
item.description:
Goalkeeper scores spectacular bicycle kick equaliser in South African Premier Division  The Telegraph

We've all seen fairytale last-minute goals being scored by keepers before, but rarely has one been as spectacular as Oscarine Masuluke's effort on Wednesday night. With Masuluke's Baroka team trailing 1-0 in the 96th minute of their South African Premier Division match against Orlando Pirates, the keeper went forward in a last-ditch attempt to get a point from the game after the home side were awarded a late corner. A goalkeeper in South Africa has equalised for his side with a last-minute bicycle kick 👏pic.twitter.com/IDDvEusrs6 — Telegraph Football (@TeleFootball) November 30, 2016 As th...

item.title: South African goalkeeper stuns football world with 96th minute overhead kick - The Independent
item.description:
South African goalkeeper stuns football world with 96th minute overhead kick  The Independent

Oscarine Masuluke is a name that would be unfamiliar even to close followers of South African football. But expect to hear it a lot more today - and possibly in the context of next year’s Puskas award - after the Baroka FC goalkeeper’s stunning goal in the 96th minute on Wednesday night. Baroka, a bottom-half team in South Africa’s Premier Division, were playing at home to relative giants Orlando Pirates and losing 1-0 with all five minutes of added time played. But when the referee decided to allow a corner, surely the last kick of the game, 23-year-old Masuluke was sent forward to try and...

item.title: Goalkeeper scores spectacular 96th-minute overhead kick in South Africa - The Guardian
item.description:
Goalkeeper scores spectacular 96th-minute overhead kick in South Africa  The Guardian

It’s been done before, but rarely in such spectacular and dramatic fashion. Goalkeepers getting their name on the scoresheet is nothing new, but not often do they perfectly execute audacious 96th-minute overhead kicks – or celebrate quite like Oscarine Masuluke. With his team trailing 1-0 and the South African top-flight match against Orlando Pirates deep into stoppage time, the Baroka FC custodian left his own box and raced forward in one final attempt to salvage something from the game. As the corner came over, his opposite number punched clear; Masuluke was first to the loose ball and wi...

item.title: Tottenham striker Harry Kane included on 2017 Ballon d’Or shortlist - The Guardian
item.description:
Tottenham striker Harry Kane included on 2017 Ballon d’Or shortlist  The Guardian

The Tottenham Hotspur striker Harry Kane has been named on a 30-man shortlist to win the 2017 Ballon d’Or. Kane has enjoyed a superb year, scoring 43 times in 37 appearances for club and country, to help Spurs qualify for the Champions League and England secure a place at the 2018 World Cup. Kane is the only Englishman in the running for the award, and joins the likes of the 2016 winner Cristiano Ronaldo, Barcelona’s Lionel Messi and Luis Suárez, and their old team-mate Neymar on the shortlist. Related: Mauricio Pochettino expects Harry Kane to ensure he needs more superlatives | Paul Doyle...
